109.title: "Jérôme Savary : L'Aventure!"
109.author: par Guy Vidal et Jean Solé
notes: Interview with Savary, who is doing a stage adaptation of Astérix, with illustrations by Solé.
"Jérôme Savary met actuellement en scéne les aventures d'Astérix. Il vous confie son univers secret et notre compère Solé en donne l'illustration."

110.heading: Astérix--Miscellanea.
110.title: "Positive Signs : Ten Worthy Translation Projects"
110.author: Bart Beaty
110.appears_in: p. 125-129 in The Comics Journal, no. 210 (Feb. 1999).
notes: Cites most prominently works from Fantagraphics, Marvel, Heavy Metal, Escape, Dark Horse, Catalan, Drawn and Quarterly, and Raw; works by Lewis Trondheim, Moebius; and Asterix and Tintin.

111.heading: Astérix--Miscellanea.
111.title: "Rendons à César"
111.author: Yves Frémion
111.appears_in: p. 29 in Schtroumpf : les Cahiers de la Bande Dessinée, no. 22 (1973).
notes: Summary: Article calls for renewal in the Franco-Belgian comics industry, because the first albums in a series are the best. End the current stories, in other words, and start over with new ones. Uses Astérix and Lucky Luke as examples, among others.

112.heading: Astérix--Miscellanea.
112.title: "René Goscinny, un Humoriste qui s'Amuse"
112.author: Numa Sadoul
112.appears_in: p. 32-33 in Schtroumpf : les Cahiers de la Bande Dessinée, no. 22 (1973).
notes: Summary: about Goscinny's writing, particularly the comedic structure of Asterix, Lucky Luke and Iznogoud stories.
